summary: Hera is an important goddess in ancient Greek mythology. She is the protector of women, marriage, and family. Hera is also the queen of Mount Olympus and Zeus's wife and sister. She is often shown as a dignified woman, wearing a crown, and sometimes a veil. Hera is known for her jealousy and would punish Zeus's lovers and children. She is associated with animals like cows, cuckoos, and peacocks. In Roman mythology, her counterpart is Juno.
title: Hera
